titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Jacki Apple Papers
1984-2000
MSS 173
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Abigail Rubin, 2011.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-08-15T10:34-0400

did.abstract: Jacki Apple is a professor at Art Center College of Design in Pasadena, California. Her career has spanned through a range of the visual and media arts. Her radio show, Soundings, of which she was the host and producer, was on KPFK-FM Los Angeles Public Radio from 1981-1995. The Jacki Apple Papers includes correspondence with artists and listeners, promotional material from artists and record labels, memos and letters pertatining to KPFK Los Angeles Public Radio business, cue sheets, and recordings of music, audio art, and interviews that were featured on the show. The collection ranges from 1984-2000.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); Jacki Apple Papers; MSS 173; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Jacki Apple is a visual, performance and media artist, writer, producer, and a professor at Art Center College of Design in Pasadena, California. Her career has spanned through a range of the visual and media arts. She has written, directed and produced interdisciplinary performance works, worked in costume design, composed and produced soundtracks, created multimedia installations, and worked with mediums of photography, audio, radio, film, site specific works, public art, and beyond.

Raised and educated in New York, Apple relocated to Los Angeles in 1981 where she continued to develop as an artist. An innovator in radio art, she was the host and producer of Soundings, her one hour weekly live radio show on KPFK-FM Los Angeles Public Radio from 1981-1995. Additionally, she co-produced the annual Earjam avant-garde music festival 2000-2004, and was a contributing editor to High Performance Magazine. She has written for numerous other art publications, and has taught at both the Art Center College of Design and the University of California, San Diego. In NYC she was a co-founder and first curator of Franklin Furnace 1976-1980. Apple's copious output of solo exhibitions, performance pieces, radio works, and installations have appeared all over the U.S. and throughout the world.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged alpahbetically within each series.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Collection use is subject to all copyright laws. Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the Director of Fales Library and Special Collections. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu. or call 212 998 2596.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open to researchers. Appointments are necessary for the use of manuscript and archival collections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Jacki Apple Papers includes correspondence with artists and listeners, promotional material from artists and record labels, memos and letters pertatining to KPFK Los Angeles Public Radio buisness, cue sheets, and recordings of music, audio art, and interviews that were featured on the show. The collection ranges from 1984-2000.
The collection is arranged by subject and by format. There are nine series:

Series I: KFPK Soundings
Series II: Record Label/Studios
Series III: Press/Promo/Catalogues
Series IV: Soundings- Radio Works/Spoken Word/Sound
Series V: Soundings- Music Tapes
Series VI: Radio Tapes with Jacki Apple/Audio Networks
Series VII: Radio Tapes with Jacki Apple/Soundings
Series VII: Artist Tapes
Series VIII: Soundings Miscellaneous

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: The Jacki Apple Papers were donated by Jacki Apple to the NYU Libraries in 2005.

did.unittitle: Series IV: Audio: Soundings - Radio Works/Spoken Word/Sound

scopecontent.head: Conditions Governing Access
scopecontent.p: Access Copies may not be available. Please consult a Fales archivist.
